The IRS warnings stem from a 1984 law that *T*-1 requires anyone who *T*-126 receives more than $ 10,000 *U* in cash from a client or customer in one or more related transactions `` in the course of trade or business '' to report the payment on a document known * as Form 8300 .	the^DT irs^NNP warnings^NNS stem^VBP from^IN a^DT 1984^CD law^NN that^WDT *t*-1^-NONE- requires^VBZ anyone^NN who^WP *t*-126^-NONE- receives^VBZ more^JJR than^IN $^$ 10,000^CD *u*^-NONE- in^IN cash^NN from^IN a^DT client^NN or^CC customer^NN in^IN one^CD or^CC more^JJR related^JJ transactions^NNS ``^`` in^IN the^DT course^NN of^IN trade^NN or^CC business^NN ''^'' to^TO report^VB the^DT payment^NN on^IN a^DT document^NN known^VBN *^-NONE- as^IN form^NN 8300^CD .^.
The form asks for such details as the client 's name , Social Security number , passport number and details about the services provided * for the payment .	the^DT form^NN asks^VBZ for^IN such^JJ details^NNS as^IN the^DT client^NN 's^POS name^NN ,^, social^NNP security^NNP number^NN ,^, passport^NN number^NN and^CC details^NNS about^IN the^DT services^NNS provided^VBN *^-NONE- for^IN the^DT payment^NN .^.

Michael Ross , a New York lawyer who *T*-132 heads the ABA 's grand jury committee , said that lawyers are prohibited *-1 by the ABA 's code of ethics from *-1 disclosing information about a client except where a court orders it *T*-3 or *-1 to prevent the client from *-4 committing a criminal act that *T*-2 could result in death .	michael^NNP ross^NNP ,^, a^DT new^NNP york^NNP lawyer^NN who^WP *t*-132^-NONE- heads^VBZ the^DT aba^NNP 's^POS grand^JJ jury^NN committee^NN ,^, said^VBD that^IN lawyers^NNS are^VBP prohibited^VBN *-1^-NONE- by^IN the^DT aba^NNP 's^POS code^NN of^IN ethics^NNS from^IN *-1^-NONE- disclosing^VBG information^NN about^IN a^DT client^NN except^IN where^WRB a^DT court^NN orders^VBZ it^PRP *t*-3^-NONE- or^CC *-1^-NONE- to^TO prevent^VB the^DT client^NN from^IN *-4^-NONE- committing^VBG a^DT criminal^JJ act^NN that^WDT *t*-2^-NONE- could^MD result^VB in^IN death^NN .^.

* Beginning in 1980 , courts in several states including California and New York decided *-2 to suspend the common-law rule that plaintiffs must prove that the defendants are the ones who *T*-1 are liable .	*^-NONE- beginning^VBG in^IN 1980^CD ,^, courts^NNS in^IN several^JJ states^NNS including^VBG california^NNP and^CC new^NNP york^NNP decided^VBD *-2^-NONE- to^TO suspend^VB the^DT common-law^NN rule^NN that^IN plaintiffs^NNS must^MD prove^VB that^IN the^DT defendants^NNS are^VBP the^DT ones^NNS who^WP *t*-1^-NONE- are^VBP liable^JJ .^.

The U.S. International Trade Commission issued preliminary rulings under the U.S. anti-dumping act that imports of sweaters from Hong Kong , Taiwan and South Korea may be injuring a domestic industry .	the^DT u.s.^NNP international^NNP trade^NNP commission^NNP issued^VBD preliminary^JJ rulings^NNS under^IN the^DT u.s.^NNP anti-dumping^JJ act^NN that^IN imports^NNS of^IN sweaters^NNS from^IN hong^NNP kong^NNP ,^, taiwan^NNP and^CC south^NNP korea^NNP may^MD be^VB injuring^VBG a^DT domestic^JJ industry^NN .^.
